alert.note: Alert for Inland Harris; Montgomery (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 3:02PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY AND NORTH CENTRAL HARRIS COUNTIES THROUGH 330 PM CDT... At 302 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hurricane Harbor Splashtown, or near Spring, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Humble, Spring, The Woodlands, Kingwood, Oak Ridge North, The Woodlands Pavillion, Chateau Woods, Hurricane Harbor Splashtown, Porter Heights, Atascocita, northern Bush Intercontinental Airport, Lake Houston, and Porter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
